blocks.text: Virtualization vulnerabilities affect hypervisors and the isolation mechanisms between virtual machines. A successful exploit may allow attackers to escape from a virtual machine and access the host or other guests.
Because many organizations consolidate workloads on shared hosts, virtualization flaws can have high impact across multiple systems simultaneously.
Attackers may target hypervisor management interfaces or exploit flaws in virtual device emulation.
Strong access controls, network segmentation, and rapid patching are essential for protecting virtualized environments.
